meanings.definition: To make promises that are unlikely to be fulfilled.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overpromise when trying to impress others.
meanings.sent3: The magician overpromises the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The politician overpromises to win votes but rarely follows through.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's overpromises left customers disappointed.

meanings.definition: To make excessive or unrealistic promises.
meanings.sent1: The company overpromises benefits to attract new employees.
meanings.sent2: Don't overpromise what you can't deliver.
meanings.sent3: The chef overpromises a 5-minute meal but takes an hour to cook.
meanings.sent4: The student overpromises to finish the project overnight.
meanings.sent5: The website overpromises instant results with their product.
